did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Wells was an educator, museum curator and author. The collection consists of an unpublished Wells' manuscript.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Henry Willis Wells Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The provenance of the Henry Willis Wells Papers is unknown.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henry Willis Wells was an educator, museum curator, and author. He was a Columbia University professor where he taught poetry and drama for many years. As Curator of the Brander Matthew Dramatic Museum, he became interested in and wrote on the plays of China, India, and Japan.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of Wells' unpublished manuscript, "Edgar Lee Masters: Portrait of a Poet." Part of the Jay B. Hubbell Center for American Literary Historiography.
